docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Circle K Corporation today temporarily suspended a plan to cut off medical coverage of workers who become sick or injured as a result of AIDS, alcohol, drug abuse or self-inflicted wounds.
docs.snippet: LEAD: The Circle K Corporation today temporarily suspended a plan to cut off medical coverage of workers who become sick or injured as a result of AIDS, alcohol, drug abuse or self-inflicted wounds.

byline.original: By KENNETH B. NOBLE, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Human studies to evaluate the first drug that was specifically designed to block the AIDS virus are beginning this week. On the basis of laboratory studies, scientists hope the drug will preventing the AIDS virus from entering and infecting cells of the immune system.

headline.main: HUMAN STUDIES START ON A DRUG DESIGNED TO BLOCK AIDS VIRUS
